chunks.text: In today's video, we will learn about Core Web Vitals and why they are important.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: Like this video and keep your energy high.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: The thing is that your website should run on all devices in iPad, iPhone, Android, Surface Pro 4.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: Because we have to give a good experience to all users through our website.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: In this video, we will also learn that there is a hidden tool in Chrome called Lighthouse.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: And how you can use it to enhance your website.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: And the thing I am going to tell you today is very important from the aspect of SEO.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: First of all, I want to tell you what SEO is.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: SEO stands for Search Engine Optimization.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: If you see any website, it has SEO in it.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: Let's take the example of Amazon.in.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: I opened Amazon.in.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: So Amazon.in wants this website to be loaded as soon as possible.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: So that their products can come in search.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: Google is a search engine.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: Google's responsibility is to show the best pages to the users.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: So Google wants to show only those pages that are fast.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: They present the information very well.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: And along with that, there are some things in them that the user has a good experience.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: For example, let's say there are two pages.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: One page has told about dog food.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: The other page has also told exactly the same thing about dog food.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: But the page 2 of these two is loaded very fast.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: It loads well.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: So Google will give it more preference.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: Along with that, there are core web vitals.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: Which Google considers to rank two pages.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: First of all, it is content.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: Content is the most important.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: What do you have on one page?
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: If your content is good, then maybe your website can rank without core web vitals.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: But if you are competing with a page that has presented almost similar quality content.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: Then your core web vitals will be seen.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: And if your core web vitals are good, then you will be given preference.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: So the first thing that comes in the core web vitals is your CLS.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: You see this video here.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: Which I have run from the web.dev website.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: You will see that someone comes to your website.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: And he is trying to cancel the order here.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: And by mistake, the time he canceled, this thing above became visible.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: And he shifted the layout.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: And the order is complete.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: But the user wanted the order to be incomplete.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: He wanted to click on no.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: In this case, the user experience is very bad.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: And as you saw in this video, it should not be like this.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: That's why our CLS should be as low as possible.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: Now what is the definition of CLS?
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: Cumulative layout shift means.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: How much is shifting while the page is loading.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: Assume that you have loaded the page.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: And first of all, you get to see this.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: It was above first.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: And after that, when this keyterm part was loaded.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: So everything shifted down.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: Layout should not shift.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: If you put width and height in images.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: Then the layout will not shift.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: The next metric we are going to talk about is LCP.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: And LCP stands for Largest Contextual Paint.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: This means that if the user is viewing a page.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: Then the biggest element on it.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: For example, the biggest part in this is this image.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: How long is it loading?
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: Means the whole page will be loaded.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: But the biggest looking element.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: Which is the most important.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: How long is it loading?
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: Assume that web.dev and Google.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: A good LCP score should be 2.5 seconds.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: Means the biggest element should be loaded in 2.5 seconds.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: After this comes the third metric which is FID.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: Which stands for First Input Delay.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: First Input Delay means that.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: If any user has clicked on any input element.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: Like on a button or any type of input.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: On a page.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: So how long does that input process?
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: For example, if you click on a button.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: So how long does that button click browser process?
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: And if we assume Google and web.dev.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: So in less than 100 milliseconds.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: Your input should start processing.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: So these were the three core web vitals.
chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML

chunks.text: Which are very important.

text: In today's video, we will learn about Core Web Vitals and why they are important. Like this video and keep your energy high. The thing is that your website should run on all devices in iPad, iPhone, Android, Surface Pro 4. Because we have to give a good experience to all users through our website. In this video, we will also learn that there is a hidden tool in Chrome called Lighthouse. And how you can use it to enhance your website. So write in the comment section below, Sigma Batch OP. Let's go to the computer screen. Let's roll the intro. So guys, I have come to my computer screen. And now I will make a new folder named Video 6. Video 6. And here in Video 6, I will open VS Code as always. And the thing I am going to tell you today is very important from the aspect of SEO. First of all, I want to tell you what SEO is. SEO stands for Search Engine Optimization. If you see any website, it has SEO in it. Let's take the example of Amazon.in. I opened Amazon.in. So Amazon.in wants this website to be loaded as soon as possible. So that their products can come in search. Google is a search engine. Google's responsibility is to show the best pages to the users. So Google wants to show only those pages that are fast. They present the information very well. And along with that, there are some things in them that the user has a good experience. For example, let's say there are two pages. One page has told about dog food. The other page has also told exactly the same thing about dog food. But the page 2 of these two is loaded very fast. It loads well. So Google will give it more preference. Along with that, there are core web vitals. Which Google considers to rank two pages. First of all, it is content. Content is the most important. What do you have on one page? If your content is good, then maybe your website can rank without core web vitals. But if you are competing with a page that has presented almost similar quality content. Then your core web vitals will be seen. And if your core web vitals are good, then you will be given preference. So the first thing that comes in the core web vitals is your CLS. You see this video here. Which I have run from the web.dev website. You will see that someone comes to your website. And he is trying to cancel the order here. And by mistake, the time he canceled, this thing above became visible. And he shifted the layout. And the order is complete. But the user wanted the order to be incomplete. He wanted to click on no. In this case, the user experience is very bad. And as you saw in this video, it should not be like this. That's why our CLS should be as low as possible. Now what is the definition of CLS? Cumulative layout shift means. How much is shifting while the page is loading. Assume that you have loaded the page. And first of all, you get to see this. It was above first. And after that, when this keyterm part was loaded. So everything shifted down. Layout should not shift. If you put width and height in images. Then the layout will not shift. The next metric we are going to talk about is LCP. And LCP stands for Largest Contextual Paint. This means that if the user is viewing a page. Then the biggest element on it. For example, the biggest part in this is this image. How long is it loading? Means the whole page will be loaded. But the biggest looking element. Which is the most important. How long is it loading? Assume that web.dev and Google. A good LCP score should be 2.5 seconds. Means the biggest element should be loaded in 2.5 seconds. After this comes the third metric which is FID. Which stands for First Input Delay. First Input Delay means that. If any user has clicked on any input element. Like on a button or any type of input. On a page. So how long does that input process? For example, if you click on a button. So how long does that button click browser process? And if we assume Google and web.dev. So in less than 100 milliseconds. Your input should start processing. So these were the three core web vitals. Which are very important. For your information. These core web vitals are updated. But these three are very important. And you should know.
